Authors: Ismanto L., Hendra Suwito A.R., Fajar A.N.
Title: SOA Integration for E-Marketplace
Source title: Proceedings - 2019 International Conference on Computer Science, Information Technology, and Electrical Engineering, ICOMITEE 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate, Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ismanto, L., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate, Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendra Suwito, A.R., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate, Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fajar, A.N., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate, Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: As E-Commerce has growth rapidly in Indonesia, it becomes a needs for small and medium enterprise (SMEs) to use couple of E-Commerce domains for business expansion purpose. This action needs a lot of effort and lack of flexibility. This study focuses on using Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) to carry out their online daily business with one another. Despite of using API-Method, the paper presents an integrated information or data that reduces redundancy process. This study is to proposed system architecture which create new solution based on SOA and ESB as the main middleware through internet. It called the SOA integration for e-marketplace. It will integrated all used E-Commerce domains to one platform to manage as Single Source The objective is for interconnecting between different domains and make it become interoperability and manageability. The impact of the interoperability, it could be possible to seller to manage product listing and order management from all domains, and gain customer's satisfaction growth and also fulfil the flexibility demand from SMEs and customers. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-Commerce; Marketplace; Marketplace Platform; Service Oriented Architecture (SOA); Single Source E-Commerce System
Index Keywords: Computer architecture; Customer satisfaction; Electronic commerce; Information services; Interoperability; Middleware; Business expansion; E-commerce systems; Integrated informations; Marketplace; Marketplace Platform; Redundancy process; Small and medium enterprise; System architectures; Service oriented architecture (SOA)

Title: Determinants of continuous transaction in mobile banking
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hendra Suwito, A.R., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study conducts researches on continuous transactions of mobile banking (M-banking) applications for users in Indonesia. Continuous transaction is a state where users make transactions repeatedly and continuously. Using four independent constructs which have relation to trust and satisfaction. By using a simple random sampling technique and evaluate the analysis using structural equation model, has discovers that continuous transactions are influenced by the satisfaction of users of M-banking application. The ease of use and usefulness felt by users also have an impact on the level of satisfaction. The results of this study indicate that to improve user satisfaction it is necessary to make improvements in other aspects, such as convenience on using M-banking application, benefits obtained, level of application security, and maintain user privacy. It is hoped that this research can provide a new perspective on the continuous transactions of M-banking application users. © 2019, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Continuous transaction; Mobile banking; Satisfaction; Structural equation model (SEM)
